en.headline: Edmonton's new zoning bylaw will help us fight climate change, lower taxes and keep the city affordable.

body.html: Edmonton loses money on every new suburb that's built. Building housing where infrastructure already exists bolsters the city's revenues and helps keep property taxes low.
body.markdown: Edmonton loses money on every new suburb that's built. Building housing where infrastructure already exists bolsters the city's revenues and helps keep property taxes low.

body.html: Building denser housing slows urban sprawl, which reduces our CO2 emissions and preserves natural environments and farmland.
body.markdown: Building denser housing slows urban sprawl, which reduces our CO2 emissions and preserves natural environments and farmland.

body.html: Making it easier to build middle density housing will boost housing supply and help keep rents low.
body.markdown: Making it easier to build middle density housing will boost housing supply and help keep rents low.

body.html:
Grow Together YEG is a coalition of everyday citizens advocating for a more sustainable, vibrant and affordable Edmonton.

Our members are not employed in the development industry and we do not receive any funding from developer groups.
body.markdown:
Grow Together YEG is a coalition of everyday citizens advocating for a more sustainable, vibrant and affordable Edmonton.

Our members are not employed in the development industry and we do not receive any funding from developer groups.

en.heading: Get Involved
en.subheading: Follow us on social media or join our mailing list to stay up to date on Zoning Bylaw Renewal, events and volunteer opportunities.Â

description.html: Dive into a world full of hidden mysteries and breathtaking views. Explore the unexplored corners of the Earth from the comfort of your own home.

content.title: BillionTrees Project
content.description: We're on a mission to save the trees

content.html:
Edmonton can't afford its infrastructure and building new neighbourhoods makes the problem worse

The city has an infrastructure maintenance deficit of $470 million per year. That's more than our entire public transit budget ($385 million) and almost as much as we spend on police ($495 million)! To make up for that deficit, we would have to raise property taxes by 28%. Having a deficit that big means we can't afford to do critical preventative maintenance, so the hole we're in will only grow larger with time.

Why can't afford to maintain the roads, bridges and sewage systems we already have? Because for decades we've been growing in an unsustainable way. Urban sprawl has wrought havoc on our balance sheets because the city loses money on every new neighborhood that gets built on the outskirts. For example, the new neighbourhood of Decoteau will add hundreds of millions of dollars to our budget shortfall once it's built.

The solution: Build up our existing neighbourhoods

The new zoning bylaw will make it easier to build new middle-density homes in mature communities. Unlike sprawl, that kind of development is great for city finances. There are a couple of reasons for this:

  1. We don't have to build new roads or utilities from scratch. Old neighbourhoods often lose money like new ones, but we have already paid for the infrastructure.
  2. Denser housing forms like row houses and small apartments are much cheaper for the city to maintain than the detached homes they replace.
content.markdown:
### Edmonton can't afford its infrastructure and building new neighbourhoods makes the problem worse 

The city has an infrastructure maintenance deficit of **$470 million per year**. That's more than our entire public transit budget ($385 million) and almost as much as we spend on police ($495 million)! To make up for that deficit, we would have to **raise property taxes by 28%**. Having a deficit that big means we can't afford to do critical preventative maintenance, so the hole we're in will only grow larger with time.

Why can't afford to maintain the roads, bridges and sewage systems we already have? Because for decades we've been growing in an unsustainable way. Urban sprawl has wrought havoc on our balance sheets because the city loses money on every new neighborhood that gets built on the outskirts. For example, the new neighbourhood of Decoteau will add hundreds of millions of dollars to our budget shortfall once it's built.

![Revenue vs Expenditures for a typical new neighbourhood](https://dpfecbhwrshlsbfgbgzq.supabase.co/storage/v1/object/public/images/2c45c57d-3334-49f6-bc6a-7fecf6135bc0/1689308724419Decoteau%20Revenue.png)

### The solution: Build up our existing neighbourhoods

The new zoning bylaw will make it easier to build new middle-density homes in mature communities. Unlike sprawl, that kind of development is great for city finances. There are a couple of reasons for this:  
1. We don't have to build new roads or utilities from scratch. Old neighbourhoods often lose money like new ones, but we have already paid for the infrastructure.
2. Denser housing forms like row houses and small apartments are much cheaper for the city to maintain than the detached homes they replace.

{headline}

content.html:
Join us on our mission

Through awareness, education, and direct action, we're working to combat climate change and protect our precious ecosystems. Together, we can make a difference.

Since our founding, we've been at the forefront of environmental conservation. Our dedicated team of scientists, activists, and volunteers works tirelessly to protect endangered species, restore critical habitats, and educate the public about the urgency of climate action.
content.markdown:
# Join us on our mission

 Through awareness, education, and direct action, we're working to combat climate change and protect our precious ecosystems. Together, we can make a difference.

Since our founding, we've been at the forefront of environmental conservation. Our dedicated team of scientists, activists, and volunteers works tirelessly to protect endangered species, restore critical habitats, and educate the public about the urgency of climate action.

body.html: We are a beacon of commitment towards preserving our forests. In the embrace of nature, we stand steadfast, advocating for the voiceless sentinels of our ecosystem. Together, we forge a path towards a greener tomorrow.
body.markdown: We are a beacon of commitment towards preserving our forests. In the embrace of nature, we stand steadfast, advocating for the voiceless sentinels of our ecosystem. Together, we forge a path towards a greener tomorrow.

body.html: Eager to leave a green footprint? Lend your hands to Lorem Ipsum Dolor. Each seed you sow, every forest you help clean, and every conversation you initiate about the importance of trees, echoes in our mission. Every action matters!
body.markdown: Eager to leave a green footprint? Lend your hands to Lorem Ipsum Dolor. Each seed you sow, every forest you help clean, and every conversation you initiate about the importance of trees, echoes in our mission. Every action matters!
